meanings.definition: The period of time during which school is in session.
meanings.sent1: During termtimes, students attend classes and learn new things.
meanings.sent2: I always look forward to the start of termtimes because I enjoy studying with my friends.
meanings.sent3: The teacher joked that during termtimes, the school becomes a second home for students.
meanings.sent4: In the world of education, termtimes are like the heartbeat of learning.
meanings.sent5: The excitement of termtimes fills the air as students prepare for a new academic journey.

meanings.definition: To schedule or arrange for a specific period of time.
meanings.sent1: I need to termtimes my study sessions to make sure I cover all the topics.
meanings.sent2: She likes to termtimes her work tasks to stay organized and meet deadlines.
meanings.sent3: Let's termtimes our meeting for tomorrow morning to discuss the project.
meanings.sent4: The event planner will termtimes the activities to ensure a smooth flow of the program.
meanings.sent5: He decided to termtimes his daily routine to include more time for exercise and relaxation.
